type_interactions.logic: Fire burns grass and melts candy, but is doused by water and outshined by stars.
Water extinguishes fire and dissolves sugar, but is absorbed by plants and conducts electricity.
Plants drink water and ground the mind against cosmic dread, but burn easily and get paved over by corporations.
Electricity shocks water and disrupts ghosts, but is insulated by wood and gummed up by sticky candy.
Sticky sugar ruins electronics and distracts aliens, but melts in heat and dissolves in water.
Ghosts terrify office workers and phase through fire, but are trapped by energy fields and consumed by the void.
Corporations destroy nature and cut power budgets, but are paralyzed by hauntings and unproductive sugar crashes.
The universe consumes spirits and dwarfs earthly fire, but is easily distracted by treats and grounded by nature.
